alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 3:16AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jewell, Smith, northeastern Phillips, southern Franklin, southern Webster and southeastern Harlan Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 316 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woodruff to 10 miles south of Riverton to near Jewell. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Alma and Jewell around 330 AM CDT. Mankato, Harlan County Dam and Inavale around 335 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Republican City, Red Cloud, Naponee, Bloomington and Cowles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings.
